name: Mexican Chicken Soup with Rice (Caldo de Pollo con Arroz)
author: Hilda
summary: This Mexican soup is a delicious combination of two delicious classic ingredients. The broth includes a spicy homemade tomato sauce.
ingredients: ½ (8 ounce) package Monterey Jack cheese, diced
directions: Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan
Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes
Place tomatoes in a pot with water to cover
Bring to a boil and cook until soft but not falling apart, 5 to 8 minutes
Peel and place in a blender; add onion, chipotle peppers, garlic, and black pepper
Strain mixture, discarding solids, for the sauce
Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat
Add carrots and celery; saute until lightly browned, about 5 minutes
Cook and stir until carrot and celery are soft, 10 to 15 minutes
Add peas and chicken breast; cook until heated through, about 3 minutes
Serve soup over a spoonful of rice; top with avocado slices and Monterey Jack cheese
